This increase is followed by a period of diminishing CO 2, with the rate of decrease proportional to the deforestation fraction caused mostly by oceanic absorption of CO 2. Atmospheric CO 2 values in the 75% and 100% scenarios fall relatively quickly, and for the duration of the experiments, remain below those of the initial peak. This is not the case for the other scenarios, where by no later than the mid 21
st century, the atmosphere holds more carbon than it had at the peak of the post deforestation pulse ( Fig 13).
